page.title: 15LANDSCAPE
page.content:
THE LAND IS FLAT EXCEPT FOR A MAN MADE MOUND TO THE SOUTH-EAST ON WHICH NEW TREES WERE PLANTED IN 1984. THE LAND IS COVERED BY CROPS, A PLAYING FIELD, SEWAGE FARM AND SEWAGE TREATMENT WORKS. THE SMELL IS OBNOXIOUS AND CAUSES DISTRESS TO EVERYONE IN THE AREA. THE ROAD TO THE NORTH OF MARKS ROAD HAS BEEN PLOUGHED UP AS HAVE THREE FOOTPATHS. THE RAMBLERS' ASSOCIATION HAD MARKED THE PATHS WITH YELLOW PEGS BUT THEY WERE REMOVED.
THE SOURCE OF THE RIVER ALVER HAS BEEN DIRECTED INTO A DITCH LEADING TO THE SEWAGE WORKS. THIS ATTRACTS SOME BIRDS. WE SAW FEW WILD FLOWERS
THE FEW HOUSES IN THE AREA ARE A MIXTURE OF OLD AND NEW DWELLINGS.
